message.content: This question requires knowledge about magnetic materials and their ability to attract magnets. Option (A) is correct because door handles are often made of metal, which can be magnetic. Option (B) is incorrect because light bulbs are typically made of glass and do not have magnetic properties. Option (C) is incorrect because pillows are typically made of non-magnetic materials like cloth or foam. Option (D) is incorrect because baseballs are typically made of non-magnetic materials like leather or synthetic materials.

This question requires knowledge about magnetism and the properties of objects that can be attracted to magnets. Objects that contain iron or other magnetic metals are attracted to magnets, while objects that do not contain these metals are not attracted. Option (A) is correct because a door handle is often made of metal, which can be attracted to a magnet. Options (B) and (C) are incorrect because light bulbs and pillows do not typically contain magnetic metals. Option (D) is incorrect because a baseball does not contain magnetic metals either.
